intro: Tetranthera apetala, commonly known as the leafless tetranthera, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of South America. The plant is characterized by its lack of true leaves, with photosynthesis occurring through its stems. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Its unique morphology makes it an interesting subject for botanical study.
